plot: Oliver examines traffic stops, where cops can easily pull over drivers for minor offenses to search for more serious crimes, despite low success rates. He suggests reforms to improve policing and community relations.

John Oliver talks about the traffic stops where police have a major freedom to harass people mostly the minority people. He explains that how easy to stop someone for minor traffic violation to look for more crimes by the driver, which has very low success rate. He also points out some easy ways to improve the situation that will help both the police and the community in general.—Niaz Islam Arif
